LbL, dude why would you unpack an iso?, iso aren't packed they are DVD images, you just mount them and then copy files if you want just the files or burn the iso to a DVD if you want bootable material.

.

Hi, Thingy, Dude...
I wanna unpack ISOs due to that then you can install directly from a folder on another harddrive...
As easy as that!

And WinRar has ALWAYS been able to unpack all ISO's (except for those BluRay-ISO's, that ain't really ISO's...) that just contains images of a CD/DVD, so there's something wrong with this ISO - it ain't made the correct way, or else WinRar would have been able to unpack it without any errors!

brianxxx: Winrar will usually extract iso ok.
Lbl: Problems when pathname (directory path + file name) gets to be too many characters, possibly due to the particular Windows OS limits or Winrar limits.
Solution: extract to root directory often solves problem. Otherwise rename very long base directory within winrar archive to something very short.
